media:group.media:title: Storming Antarctica (Full Episode) | Continent 7: Antarctica
media:group.media:description:
Immerse yourself in Alberta’s wide-open spaces in this 360-degree experience as National Geographic Travel Photographer Kahli April hikes the Matapiiksi (Hoodoo) Interpretive Trail. Kahli is joined on the trail by Blackfoot Elder Saa’kokoto who explains the immense cultural and spiritual significance of the land to the Blackfoot people, and how the rock art was made on the ancient hoodoo rock formations. All aerial imagery was obtained under permit from Alberta Parks. Paid content for Travel Alberta

entry.title: A String of Shark Attacks in San Diego | When Sharks Attack

media:group.media:title: A String of Shark Attacks in San Diego | When Sharks Attack
media:group.media:description:
Off the coast of San Diego California a swimmer is fatally wounded in a shark attack. This attack was the first fatal attack in 50 years and marked the beginning of a slew of abnormal encounters over a 7 month period.

entry.title: The Surprising Superpowers of Sharks | Podcast | Overheard at National Geographic

media:group.media:title: The Surprising Superpowers of Sharks | Podcast | Overheard at National Geographic
media:group.media:description:
Sharks have never been able to outswim their reputation as mindless killers, which is so entrenched that the U.S. Navy once even tried to weaponize them. But are sharks really just “remorseless eating machines” on the hunt for blood? Hop in the water with marine scientists for a look at sharks’ extraordinary senses and unique adaptability. ➡ Subscribe: http://bit.ly/NatGeoSubscribe

media:group.media:title: Forest of the Golden Monkey (Full Episode) | China's Hidden Kingdoms
media:group.media:description:

media:group.media:title: Why Do Sand Tiger Sharks Form Gangs? | Shark Gangs
media:group.media:description:

media:group.media:description:

entry.title: How a Shark's Vision Works | When Sharks Attack

media:group.media:title: How a Shark's Vision Works | When Sharks Attack
media:group.media:description:
In 2017, off the coast of Miami there was a dramatic increase in shark attacks. Investigators follow a series of a leads to figure out what could have caused in the increase in shark attacks. One theory has to do with how a shark sees and how compromised vision could cause more encounters between people and sharks.
